‚ñ™Ô∏è Who will get the vaccine?      
The criteria for administration of COVID-19 vaccination was devised based on groups who were most at risk to exposure or developing serious illnesses. The first prioritized group was healthcare and frontline workers, followed by the population above 45 years of age. From May 1, the vaccination process has included everyone above 18 years of age.

‚ñ™Ô∏è How will the vaccine be given & how many doses?
It will be given as an injection intramuscularly, in the upper arm. 
Two doses of the vaccine need to be taken by an individual to complete the vaccination schedule.
The recommended intervals between the 2 doses of the COVID Vaccines: 
COVAXIN: 4 to 6 weeks
COVISHIELD: 12 to 16 weeks
SPUTNIK-V: 21 days

‚ñ™Ô∏è Will the vaccine be safe or there are side effect?
The safety of COVID Vaccine is scientifically proven. As with all vaccines, minor events such as mild to moderate fever, body pain and swelling at injection site, etc. may be expected following COVID-19 vaccination. The vaccine administrators are fully equipped to take care of these. The beneficiaries are requested to wait for 30 minutes post vaccination at the session site.
 
‚ñ™Ô∏è Can a person choose date and time of vaccination?
After registering though the Co-WIN Portal, you can choose your place of vaccination by searching with your pincode or District/State and the date and time will be provided via SMS on your registered mobile number. CoWIN allows you to register at any place.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Can person with active COVID infection be vaccinated?
Person with active symptom of COVID 19 infection may defer the vaccination for 3 months after recovery..

‚ñ™Ô∏è Can a pregnant lady or lactating mother be vaccinated?
COVID-19 vaccination is recommended for all lactating women. The matter regarding COVID-19 Vaccination of pregnant women is under discussion and further deliberation by the National Technical Advisory Group on Immunization (NTAGI).

Note: Social distance and wearing masks are mandatory.

üü¢ Type "Menu" to view the Main Menu.

Dr. Pulkit Mathur will clear all your doubts and share 5 rules one should follow to stay healthy. Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

Most people who fall sick with COVID-19 will experience mild to moderate symptoms and recover without special treatment. However, some will become seriously ill and require medical attention.

The virus can spread from an infected person‚Äôs mouth or nose in small liquid particles when they cough, sneeze, speak, sing or breathe. These particles range from larger respiratory droplets to smaller aerosols.

You can be infected by breathing in the virus if you are near someone who has COVID-19, or by touching a contaminated surface and then your eyes, nose or mouth. The virus spreads more easily indoors and in crowded settings.
